text: Tridrepana aequinota is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Allan Watson in 1957. It is found on Buru in Indonesia. The wingspan is about 31.8-34.6 mm. Adults are similar to Tridrepana albonotata, but can be distinguished by the more uniformly marked subterminal line on the upperside of the forewings. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1957 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of Indonesia
title: Tridrepana aequinota
